items.content_html:
Summary

This PR adds multiple related features that go together to enable the creation of exit/entrance animations using simple CSS, or to put it another way, animating to/from display: none, or animating elements when they have just been added to the DOM.

Specifically, these are:

  • @starting-style: Chrome 117
  • The overlay property: Chrome 117
  • Animating to/from display: none and content-visibility: hidden: Chrome 116
  • The transition-behavior property: Chrome 117 (this was already added, but it is related, so I checked it)

See my research document for more details of what this project aims to add.

Test results and supporting details

Related issues
items.title: overlay, starting-style, discrete animations

items.content_html:
This PR updates and corrects version values for Chromium (Chrome, Opera, Samsung Internet, WebView Android) for the timeline-scope CSS property. The data comes from the mdn-bcd-collector project (v10.2.3).

Check out the collector's guide on how to review this PR.

Tests Used: https://mdn-bcd-collector.gooborg.com/tests/css/properties/timeline-scope
items.title: Update Chromium data for timeline-scope CSS property

items.content_html:
Summary

Update Opera's compatibility data for Cross-Origin-Resource-Policy (CORP)

Test results and supporting details

  1. Tested by running WPT tests on Opera and checked devtools console for CORP related error messages (e.g. Failed to load resource: net::ERR_BLOCKED_BY_RESPONSE.NotSameOrigin)
  2. Opera 60 is based on Chromium 73, which was the version CORP was added to Chromium.
items.title: Include Opera 60+ support for `Cross-Origin-Resource-Policy`

items.content_html:
Summary

The prefetch attribute was in the html->elements->link BCD data twice:

  1. As a direct prefetch attribute. As far as I know this was never supported and I think it was a typo.
  2. As a rel=prefetch attribute. This is the correct one.

This is confusing as gives incorrect - and conflicting - support information on the <link> MDN page and in caniuse.

As part of this PR, I also moved the "Secure context required" setting to a note - it was also incorrect (it only said Chrome needed it, when Firefox needs it too), and added Safari support behind a flag.

Test results and supporting details

https://wpt.fyi/results/preload/prefetch-types.https.html?label=experimental&label=master&aligned

Related issues
items.title: Removes duplicate link prefetch entry

items.content_html: This PR moves the WebAssembly API data out of the JavaScript builtins folder and into the WebAssembly folder. This is an attempt to fix #20349.
items.title: Move WebAssembly API out of JavaScript builtins

items.content_html:
Summary

The Window Management API was implemented in Chrome 100 (see ChromeStatus entry); this PR provides complete BCD for it (some was available already).

Test results and supporting details

Related issues
items.title: Add complete BCD for Window Management API

items.content_html:
Summary

Expands cookies.SameSiteStatus details to include the values this type takes with details of support and variations.

Related issues

BCD update for mdn/content#28721
items.title: cookies.SameSiteStatus update

items.content_html: This PR is a part of a project to add missing interfaces and interface features to BCD that are from an active spec (including WICG specs) and is supported in at least one browser. This particular PR adds the missing features of the NumberFormat member of the Intl JavaScript builtin. This fixes #6046 by adding the missing arguments. Note: all data was simply mirrored from the main constructor's data, assuming they are all features that were supported since the constructor was introduced.
items.title: Add missing features for javascript.builtins.Intl.NumberFormat

items.content_html:
Summary

Add an api/ entry for Secure Payment Confirmation. It consists of three main sub-features:

  1. PaymentCredentialInstrument, a dictionary (minor)
  2. payment-extension, a WebAuthn extension that the SPC spec defines
  3. secure-payment-confirmation, a Payment Request payment method that the SPC spec defines

Test results and supporting details

Data was written using the author's knowledge of when SPC released on Chrome, and which other browsers inherit from Chrome. Some of this still needs to be manually verified, such as the status on Opera and Samsung Internet Browser.
items.title: Add BCD data for Secure Payment Confirmation

items.content_html:
This PR removes the type member of the area HTML element from BCD. Per the data guidelines, this feature can be considered irrelevant and may be removed from BCD accordingly. Even if the current data suggests that the feature is supported, lack of support has been confirmed by the mdn-bcd-collector project (v10.2.1).

Tests Used: https://mdn-bcd-collector.gooborg.com/tests/html/elements/area/type
items.title: Remove html.elements.area.type from BCD

items.content_html: This PR is a follow-up to #20497 which fixes the data by replacing the improper alternative_name with notes and adding a version_removed (as confirmed locally). removing all mention of the former methods available on the Array prototype.
items.title: Remove mention of Array.group[ToMap]

items.content_html: This PR updates and corrects version values for Microsoft Edge for the persistent member of the background Web Extensions manifest property. This fixes #12702.
items.title: Update Edge data for webextensions.manifest.background.persistent

items.content_html:
This PR is a part of a project to add missing interfaces and interface features to BCD that are from an active spec (including WICG specs) and is supported in at least one browser. This particular PR adds the missing features of the wrap.hard member of the textarea HTML element. The data comes from manual testing, running test code through BrowserStack, SauceLabs and custom VMs.

Test Code: http://wpt.live/html/semantics/forms/the-textarea-element/wrap-enumerated-ascii-case-insensitive.html

Additional Notes: This fixes #10164. (In that PR, the attribute is inaccurately described as "unsupported", but it is just the hard value that is unsupported in Firefox and Safari.)
items.title: Add missing features for html.elements.textarea.wrap.hard

items.content_html:
This PR removes the referrerpolicy member of the a SVG element from BCD. Per the data guidelines, this feature can be considered irrelevant and may be removed from BCD accordingly. Even if the current data suggests that the feature is supported, lack of support has been confirmed by the mdn-bcd-collector project (v10.2.0).

Tests Used: https://mdn-bcd-collector.gooborg.com/tests/svg/elements/a/referrerpolicy

Additional Notes: This attribute is only available on HTML anchor elements, not SVG anchor elements.
items.title: Remove svg.elements.a.referrerpolicy from BCD

Even if the current data suggests that the feature is supported, lack of support has been confirmed by the mdn-bcd-collector project (v10.2.0).

items.title: Remove subfeatures of body HTML element from BCD
